intro: Scandicium stellatum var. decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive star plant, is a rare and striking member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its star-shaped, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often mistaken for other similar species due to its deceptive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in woodland areas. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a subject of interest for botanists and nature enthusiasts alike.
